meanings.definition: To change the direction or position of something.
meanings.sent1: She needed to reorient the map to face north.
meanings.sent2: After getting lost, he had to reorient himself to find his way back.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reorient the stubborn cat towards the litter box was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The storm caused the ship to reorient its course towards safer waters.
meanings.sent5: The dancer had to reorient her steps to match the new choreography.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: He had to reorient his thinking to understand the concept.
meanings.sent2: After moving to a new country, she needed to reorient herself to the different culture.
meanings.sent3: The robot had to reorient its sensors to detect the approaching danger.
meanings.sent4: The students had to reorient their study habits for the upcoming exams.
meanings.sent5: The company had to reorient its marketing strategy to reach a wider audience.
